00:00:03:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:03:040000.Dialogue: It was a nice retirement party.

00:00:05:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:05:010000.Dialogue: I guess. Still, it's a shame Professor Rothman was forced to step down.

00:00:10:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:10:040000.Dialogue: What choice did the university have? He snapped. It happens to theoretical physicists all the time.

00:00:16:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:16:020000.Dialogue: I wonder how long Sheldon's got.

00:00:20:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:20:100000.Dialogue: These shrimp are all the same size. There's no the logical order to eat them in.

00:00:30:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:30:050000.Dialogue: Hey, look, there's Rothman's empty office. Sad.

00:00:43:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:43:190000.Dialogue: What are you doing here, Kripke?

00:00:45:190000.Speaker: Kripke
00:00:45:190000.Dialogue: Ah, measuring my new office for drapes.

00:00:48:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:48:150000.Dialogue: This is not your office. It hasn't been assigned yet.

00:00:51:170000.Speaker: Kripke
00:00:51:170000.Dialogue: Well, I called dibs at the Christmas party when Professor Rothman tried to have intercourse with the Toys for Tots collection box.

00:00:57:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:57:190000.Dialogue: Dibs?! This is a university, not a playground. Offices are not assigned because someone called dibs.

00:01:04:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:04:190000.Dialogue: Shut it. Offices are assigned by seniority. I arrived at the university first.

00:01:10:170000.Speaker: Kripke
00:01:10:170000.Dialogue: I arrived at the office first. I'm the proverbial early bird.

00:01:27:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:27:170000.Dialogue: I'm glad that men are wearing hats again.

00:02:06:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:06:130000.Dialogue: I got you a little something.

00:02:16:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:16:090000.Dialogue: What's huge is what you've done for me.

00:02:18:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:18:110000.Dialogue: Oh, no, Amy, I haven't done anything.

00:02:20:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:20:140000.Dialogue: No, no, before I met you, I was a mousy wallflower. But look at me now. I'm like some kind of downtown hipster party girl.

00:02:28:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:28:160000.Dialogue: With a posse, a boyfriend and a new lace bra that hooks in the front, of all things.

00:02:46:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:02:46:160000.Dialogue: I wanted to get you something you didn't have.

00:02:49:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:49:040000.Dialogue: Wow! I... I don't know what to... Wow.

00:03:00:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:03:00:000000.Dialogue: So, uh, where are you gonna hang it?

00:03:02:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:02:200000.Dialogue: Oh, my God. Hang it. Wow. Um, you know, I'd have to go get a hook and nails and a hammer and...

00:03:20:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:20:200000.Dialogue: I found him. He's in the bathroom. President Siebert?

00:03:26:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:26:140000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. We just need a word.

00:03:28:090000.Speaker: Siebert
00:03:28:090000.Dialogue: Now? You realize I'm your boss, and I am holding my penis?

00:03:32:130000.Speaker: Kripke
00:03:32:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, give the man some privacy. I'm sorry. This guy's got no respect for boundaries.

00:03:40:200000.Speaker: Kripke
00:03:40:200000.Dialogue: Will you tell this lunatic that Professor Rothman's office is rightfully mine?

00:03:44:020000.Speaker: Siebert
00:03:44:020000.Dialogue: Can't you take this up with your department chairman?

00:03:46:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:46:060000.Dialogue: We tried. His assistant said he was on sabbatical. Although we distinctly heard his office window open and shut.

00:03:53:040000.Speaker: Siebert
00:03:53:040000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, there's a task I'm trying to accomplish here, and I'm having trouble doing it.

00:03:57:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:57:110000.Dialogue: Oh, my. President Siebert, I don't mean to be an alarmist, but difficulty initiating a urine stream could be a symptom of benign prostatic hyperplasia.

00:04:06:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:06:110000.Dialogue: If you're interested, I can send you a link to a YouTube video that'll show you how to perform your own rectal exam. Uh, helpful hint-- trim your nails first.

00:04:19:060000.Speaker: Kripke
00:04:19:060000.Dialogue: Ignore him, President Siebert. I'm sure a young man such as yourself has a perfectly... healthy prostate.

00:04:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:25:130000.Dialogue: Oh, he's just trying to butter you up. And for the record, butter is an excellent lubricant for your rectal exam.

00:04:32:070000.Speaker: Siebert
00:04:32:070000.Dialogue: Gentlemen, I'm going to allow the two of you to work this out because A) you're both brilliant scientists, and B) as far as who gets Rothman's office, I couldn't give the furry crack of a rat's behind.

00:04:46:210000.Speaker: Kripke
00:04:46:210000.Dialogue: Well, as long as we're here, I might as well take a leak.

00:05:22:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:22:000000.Dialogue: So ugly. What am I gonna do?

00:05:25:050000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:25:050000.Dialogue: I don't know. You can't take it down. You'll break her heart. Look at that face. That enormous, unsettling, crazy face.

00:05:38:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:38:160000.Dialogue: Is there any chance I'll learn to love it?

00:05:40:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:40:190000.Dialogue: That depends. Do you like pictures of yourself where you look like a man?

00:05:46:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:46:000000.Dialogue: All right, it's got to go.

00:05:51:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:51:030000.Dialogue: How about I tell her the painting makes you feel jealous because you're not in it?

00:05:55:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:55:070000.Dialogue: Nuh-uh. What if she gets me one?

00:06:00:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:00:160000.Dialogue: I already have a picture of me and Howard's mom getting our hair cornrowed in Venice Beach. I've suffered enough.

00:06:06:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:06:130000.Dialogue: Well, I guess I could take it down and put it up when she comes over, but it's kind of heavy.

00:06:10:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:06:10:160000.Dialogue: Oh, too bad you're not as strong as the dude in the painting.

00:06:18:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:18:030000.Dialogue: Would you look at this? I paid $25 to some kid on eBay for a handcrafted Harry Potter wand. He sent me a stick.

00:06:28:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:28:220000.Dialogue: He went into his backyard, he picked up a stick.

00:06:43:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:43:010000.Dialogue: We're going to work this office situation out like gentlemen. And if that doesn't work, I'm going to poison his tea.

00:06:52:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:52:100000.Dialogue: I'm making tea. Would you like a cup?

00:06:56:180000.Speaker: Kripke
00:06:56:180000.Dialogue: Am I wearing a summer frock? No, I don't want tea.

00:07:01:020000.Speaker: Kripke
00:07:01:020000.Dialogue: Let's get down to brass tacks.

00:07:03:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:03:090000.Dialogue: Fine. In the interest of preserving our friendship...

00:07:08:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:08:060000.Dialogue: Well, that's a little hard to hear, but all right.

00:07:12:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:12:190000.Dialogue: As you know, the essence of diplomacy is compromise. With that in mind, I propose the following. I will take Rothman's office, and you will find a way to be okay with that.

00:07:28:030000.Speaker: Kripke
00:07:28:030000.Dialogue: How about I take Rothman's office, and you go suck a lemon?

00:07:39:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:39:080000.Dialogue: You sure I can't get you that cup of tea?

00:07:43:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:43:010000.Dialogue: How about you decide this with Rock-Paper-Scissors Lizard-Spock?

00:07:50:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:50:000000.Dialogue: Rock-Paper-Scissors-Lizard-Spock was created by Internet pioneer Sam Kass as an improvement on the classic game Rock-Paper-Scissors. All hail Sam Kass.

00:08:04:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:04:110000.Dialogue: Oh, it's very simple. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons Spock, Spock smashes scissors, scissors decapitates lizard, lizard eats paper, paper disproves Spock, Spock vaporizes rock, and as it always has, rock crushes scissors.

00:08:26:180000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:26:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Can you repeat that?

00:08:30:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:30:020000.Dialogue: Well, of course. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock crushes lizard, lizard poisons Spock, Spock smashes scissors, scissors decapitates lizard, lizard eats paper, paper disproves Spock, Spock vaporizes rock, and as it always has, rock crushes scissors.

00:08:47:130000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:47:130000.Dialogue: Almost got it. One more time.

00:08:49:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:49:140000.Dialogue: Surely. Scissors cuts paper, paper covers rock, rock...

00:08:51:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:51:180000.Dialogue: Sheldon, stop. He's screwing with you.

00:08:54:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:54:140000.Dialogue: Is he? Well, then, it seems we have reached an impasse. I see no other option than to challenge you to a duel. I'd smack you with a glove, but just last week, I packed away my winter things.

00:09:09:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:09:080000.Dialogue: It's the 21st century. You can't have a duel.

00:09:16:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:16:140000.Dialogue: Barry, how good of a shot are you?

00:09:20:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:20:220000.Dialogue: Not pistols. Minds. A trivia contest, and you may choose the field of battle. Star Trek trivia, Star Trek: Next Generation trivia, Star Trek: Deep Space Nine trivia, Star Trek: Voyager trivia, or model trains.

00:09:35:140000.Speaker: Kripke
00:09:35:140000.Dialogue: You have a complete advantage in trivia. You have an eidetic memory. Plus, I haven't watched Star Trek since I discovered the strip club near my apartment has a free buffet.

00:09:46:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:46:090000.Dialogue: LEONARD: It's gonna be hard to find something you're both equally good at.

00:09:50:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:50:040000.Dialogue: Is there anything you're both equally bad at?

00:10:02:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:02:180000.Dialogue: All right, this is one-on-one. First person to five wins the office. Any questions? Yes, Sheldon.

00:10:46:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:46:170000.Dialogue: You know all those terrible things bullies used to do to us?

00:11:02:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:02:130000.Dialogue: Hey! He did that on purpose!

00:11:07:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:07:100000.Dialogue: No, he didn't. Nothing that's happening here is being done on purpose.

00:11:12:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:12:080000.Dialogue: Okay, uh, forget one-on-one. Let's try a free throw contest. First person who makes a basket wins the office.

00:11:19:200000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:19:200000.Dialogue: Making it too easy there, Hofstadter.

00:11:27:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:27:050000.Dialogue: Use the force, Sheldon. Use the force.

00:11:38:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:38:150000.Dialogue: All right, Cooper, prepare to have your heart broken.

00:11:46:080000.Speaker: Kripke
00:11:46:080000.Dialogue: Do I get points for that?

00:12:08:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:08:040000.Dialogue: All right, we gave it 45 minutes. It's no longer funny. Let's try something else.

00:12:16:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:16:100000.Dialogue: Uh, on the count of three, both of you bounce the balls as hard as you can. The highest bounce wins the office.

00:12:21:200000.Speaker: Kripke
00:12:21:200000.Dialogue: Oh, you are going down, Cooper.

00:12:23:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:23:200000.Dialogue: I don't think so, Kripke. I've bounced many a rubber ball in my day.

00:12:27:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:27:140000.Dialogue: All right, that's enough trash talk.

00:12:55:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:55:040000.Dialogue: I cannot believe you've never seen Grease.

00:12:57:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:57:110000.Dialogue: My mother didn't allow me to watch it. She was afraid it might encourage me to join a gang.

00:13:04:020000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:04:020000.Dialogue: I've got to go. I've got to get up early. My company's testing a new steroid that supposedly doesn't shrink testicles, and the last one there has to do e measuring.

00:13:13:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:13:220000.Dialogue: I guess I should get going, too. Good night, painting Penny. Good night, real Penny.

00:13:24:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:24:140000.Dialogue: You don't have to say good night to painting Amy, 'cause she's never leaving.

00:13:42:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:42:030000.Dialogue: Okay. Let us take you off the wall. Out of sight, out of mind. I wish.

00:13:54:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:54:150000.Dialogue: You know, can I borrow that movie?

00:13:57:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:57:090000.Dialogue: Those singing hooligans really got my motor running.

00:13:59:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:59:160000.Dialogue: Sure, sure. Enjoy. I mean, get it back to me when you can, or... you know what, actually, you keep it. It's just going to be my gift to you. Bye.

00:14:07:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:07:000000.Dialogue: Thank you. Wait... Where'd the painting go?

00:14:16:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:16:060000.Dialogue: I have no idea. That is weird.

00:14:29:070000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:29:070000.Dialogue: Why? So you can just take it down when I leave? I don't need your pity.

00:14:33:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:33:170000.Dialogue: (choking up): I'm just glad I didn't go for the sculpture.

00:14:40:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:40:020000.Dialogue: Ah, the spoils. I see why victors love them.

00:14:47:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:47:080000.Dialogue: I'm happy for you, Sheldon. But I have to admit I'm going to miss sharing an office with you.

00:14:51:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:51:110000.Dialogue: Oh, of course you are. Feel free to drop by any time.

00:15:07:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:07:110000.Dialogue: Professor Rothman. This isn't your office anymore. You're retired.

00:15:11:150000.Speaker: Rothman
00:15:11:150000.Dialogue: I think the word you're looking for is... invisible.

00:15:20:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:20:230000.Dialogue: I came to say I'm sorry.

00:15:31:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:31:230000.Dialogue: I was a fool from Summer Lovin' to the very last rama lama lama ke ding a de dinga a dong.

00:15:37:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:37:200000.Dialogue: You're right. You're absolutely right. I should have been honest with you and told you the gift was too much.

00:15:42:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:42:180000.Dialogue: Yes, too much. Because our friendship is fundamentally asymmetrical. I clearly like you more than you like me.

00:15:50:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:50:000000.Dialogue: I don't think you can put a number on how much one person likes another.

00:15:53:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:53:090000.Dialogue: I bought you a painting that's 12 square feet in area. There's a number.

00:15:59:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:59:110000.Dialogue: If you don't like feet, you can try dollars. The painting set me back three grand.

00:16:06:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:06:180000.Dialogue: Look, look, Amy, all you need to know is, you are my friend and I don't want to lose you out of my life.

00:16:13:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:13:090000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm just having trouble believing you right now.

00:16:23:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:23:130000.Dialogue: Okay, look, I didn't want to say this, but the real reason I took the painting down was... because it made Bernadette very jealous.

00:16:34:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:34:160000.Dialogue: Oh, my goodness, how could I have not seen that? The painting is a constant reminder that of the three of us, she is the least cool.

00:16:44:220000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:44:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:44:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's... that's what it is, so...

00:16:49:020000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:49:020000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:49:020000.Dialogue: You have such a good heart.

00:16:50:120000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:50:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:53:050000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:53:050000.Speaker: Amy

00:16:55:010000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:55:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:55:010000.Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, where are we going?

00:16:56:130000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:56:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:56:130000.Dialogue: We're going to go put this painting back up in your apartment.

00:16:58:040000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:58:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:59:160000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:16:59:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:59:160000.Dialogue: Oh, screw her. She's just lucky we let her hang out with us.

00:17:25:150000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:17:25:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:26:200000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:17:26:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:26:200000.Dialogue: I'm trying to raise the temperature in here before my nipples tear through my shirt.

00:17:32:180000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:17:32:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:32:180000.Dialogue: Why don't you just turn up the thermostat?

00:17:35:150000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:17:35:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:35:150000.Dialogue: Aha! Good question. It turns out the thermostat for my new office isn't in my new office. No. It's next door, in Professor Davenport's office, who is currently enjoying the hot flashes associated with menopause.

00:17:48:160000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:17:48:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:48:160000.Dialogue: Why is there a hole here?

00:17:50:200000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:17:50:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:50:200000.Dialogue: Why is there a hole in my new office? I've narrowed it down to two possibilities: There was something in the wall that someone outside the wall wanted, or the more disturbing, there was something in the wall that wanted out.

00:18:05:070000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:05:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:05:070000.Dialogue: Well, at least you finally got a window that opens. That's nice.

00:18:08:150000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:08:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:12:020000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:12:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:12:020000.Dialogue: What, you don't like wind chimes?

00:18:13:060000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:13:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:13:060000.Dialogue: No, I hate them, but it gets worse.

00:18:18:180000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:18:180000.Speaker: Howard

00:18:21:090000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:21:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:21:090000.Dialogue: It's completely out of tune with the wind chimes.

00:18:25:000000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:25:000000.Speaker: Raj

00:18:25:230000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:25:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:25:230000.Dialogue: You don't get it, do you? That's a mockingbird. Mockingbirds can change their song, which means he's out of tune on purpose.

00:18:34:020000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:34:020000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:36:190000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:36:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:36:190000.Dialogue: Oh dear. There it is again. Do you feel it?

00:18:39:020000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:39:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:39:020000.Dialogue: The growing realization that you are one wacky bastard? Yep.

00:18:43:040000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:43:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:43:040000.Dialogue: No. The vibration. We are directly underneath the geology lab, and they're running their confounded sieve shakers again. Hey, gravel monkeys, if you need to shake rocks, try jiggling your heads around!

00:18:54:170000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:54:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:57:000000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:18:57:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:57:000000.Dialogue: How can I relax? My nervous system is being stretched out like the strings of a harp and plucked by holes and birds and wind and the low-hanging scrotum of the difficult-to-evict Professor Rothman.

00:19:10:030000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:19:10:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:10:030000.Dialogue: If you're not happy, why don't you just let Kripke have the office?

00:19:12:220000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon is trying to affix paper over a fiercely blowing air vent.
00:19:12:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:12:220000.Dialogue: Wait, and let him win? Do I look crazy to you? We're trying to think down here, you geode-loving feldspar jockeys! And you... the notes are C, D, E, G and A. You pick one or I am chopping down that tree!

00:19:41:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:41:230000.Dialogue: Little more. No. That's got it.

00:19:47:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:47:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, okay. That's, uh, that's good.

00:19:51:090000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:51:090000.Dialogue: I'll let you in on a little secret.

00:20:02:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:02:190000.Dialogue: But I had him add clothes, 'cause I thought it was an unnecessary challenge to our heterosexuality.

00:20:13:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:13:170000.Dialogue: But if you ever change your mind, all it would take is some warm, soapy water and a couple of sponges.

00:20:20:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:20:020000.Dialogue: You're talking about the painting, right?

00:20:28:060000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:28:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:20:34:100000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:34:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:35:180000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:35:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:35:180000.Dialogue: I was trying to see what was in here and my head got stuck.

00:20:39:120000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:39:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:41:150000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:41:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:20:45:170000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:45:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:20:47:180000.Scene: Rothman’s office. Sheldon has his head stuck in the hole in the wall.
00:20:47:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:47:180000.Dialogue: Hang in there. I'll be right back.
